A **pit viper**, S, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a type of [snake](/wiki/Snake_\(monster_class\) "Snake (monster class)") that has [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"), and can [swim](/wiki/Swim "Swim") and [hide](/wiki/Hide "Hide") under objects like other snakes.

A pit viper has two [poisonous](/wiki/Poison "Poison") bite attacks, and possesses [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance").

A pit viper [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") is poisonous to eat, but eating a pit viper corpse or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") has a 2⁄5 chance of conveying poison resistance.

Pit vipers generate [YAFM](/wiki/YAFM "YAFM") when falling into [pits](/wiki/Pit "Pit") or [spiked pits](/wiki/Spiked_pit "Spiked pit"), which they share with [pit fiends](/wiki/Pit_fiend "Pit fiend").[\[1\]](#cite_note-dotrap-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-mintrap-2)

## Generation

Randomly generated pit vipers are always created hostile.

Pit vipers generate among the random S that are part of the first quest [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") for [Archeologists](/wiki/Archeologist "Archeologist") and make up 24⁄35 of the monsters that randomly generate on the [Archeologist quest](/wiki/Archeologist_quest "Archeologist quest").

Pit vipers may generate among the random snakes that appear on the first and fourth variants of [Medusa's Island](/wiki/Medusa%27s_Island "Medusa's Island") at level creation. Five pit vipers are generated on the [Plane of Earth](/wiki/Plane_of_Earth "Plane of Earth") at level creation.

Pit vipers generated at level creation are given a random item to hide under.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

## Strategy

Pit vipers move fairly fast at 15 [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed"), and combined with their poisonous bites they can pose a deadly threat to a [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") lacking poison resistance. Fortunately, their tendency to hide can potentially be exploited with ranged weapons, and obtaining poison resistance significantly weakens their damage output.

## History

The pit viper first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Pit viper](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Search/Pit_viper "wikipedia:Special:Search/Pit viper")***

The pit viper, also known as the pit adder, is the name for a group of vipers in the subfamily *Crotalinae* that are found in Eurasia and the Americas, and are the only vipers to have a habitat in the Americas - currently, 23 genera and 155 species are recognized. Like all other vipers, they are venomous.

Pit vipers are named for the heat-sensing pit organ located between the eye and the nostril on both sides of their head. When prey comes into range, these allow the snake to determine its direction, with the location of the pits on either side of the head producing a stereo effect that indicates both direction and distance. Experiments have shown that when deprived of their senses of sight and smell, pit vipers can strike accurately at moving objects that are less than 0.2 °C (0.36 °F) warmer than the background temperature - this makes the pits a valuable adaptation for a nocturnal hunter like the pit viper, as well as a key means of detecting and avoiding its own predators. Pit vipers also have a unique specialized muscle between the venom gland and the head that allows them to shoot venom from the gland - an ability that the pit viper of *NetHack* lacks.

## Message

- How pitiful. Isn't that the pits?

  You saw a pit viper fall into a pit, or fell into one while polymorphed into a pit viper.[\[1\]](#cite_note-dotrap-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-mintrap-2)

## Variants

In variants that incorporate the [Convict](/wiki/Convict "Convict") role, a pit viper is generated on the upper filler level of the [Convict quest](/wiki/Convict_quest "Convict quest") at level creation.

### SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, pit vipers are not randomly generated in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom").

[Weresnakes](/wiki/Weresnake "Weresnake") summoning help have a 1⁄5 chance of generating a hostile pit viper on each applicable square[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)—a hero that gets lycanthropy from a weresnake can summon pit vipers as pets with the same probability by using the [#monster](/wiki/Monster_\(command\) "Monster (command)") [extended command](/wiki/Extended_command "Extended command"), which costs 10 [power](/wiki/Power "Power").

The Snake Pit of the [Lawful Quest](/wiki/Lawful_Quest "Lawful Quest") can generate up to two pit vipers at level creation: there is a 9⁄10 chance of each viper appearing, with one viper generated asleep if it is created. They may also appear among the random S generated at level creation.

All of the above information also applies to [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM").

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), pit vipers can be randomly generated in Gehennom compared to SLASH'EM.

Weresnakes summoning help have a 2⁄15 chance of generating a hostile pit viper on each applicable square, and a hero that gets lycanthropy from a weresnake can summon pit vipers as pets with the same probability by using the #monster extended command at the cost of 10 power.

SLASH'EM details for pit vipers in the Lawful Quest apply in Hack'EM.

## Encyclopedia entry
